2019-08-01.name: Build up the venue with us
2019-08-01.description: This is completely optional but if you're already in town and feel like hanging out and arranging some chairs with us, feel free to join us as well build up the venue.
2019-08-01.requirements: A smile and a slight bit of boredom :)

2019-08-01.name: Guide City Tour I
2019-08-01.description: Historian and actor Toon de Kegel will guide us through the streets and the history of Leuven. There is another tour at 17:00.
2019-08-01.location: We meet in front of city hall
2019-08-01.requirements: Check the weather and bring rain gear if necessary.

2019-08-01.name: Guided City Tour II
2019-08-01.description: Historian and actor Toon de Kegel will guide us through the streets and the history of Leuven. There is another tour at 15:00.
2019-08-01.location: We meet in front of city hall
2019-08-01.requirements: Check the weather and bring rain gear if necessary.

2019-08-01.name: Pre-conference get-together
2019-08-01.description: Come and hang out! Exact bars to be decided. Keep an eye on [our Twitter feed](https://twitter.com/heartofclojure)

2019-08-02.name: Adventurous Dinner
2019-08-02.description:
This dinner event is intended for those brave Clojure souls who have not yet booked another dinner on Friday evening. 

The idea is that we will pool together everyone interested, take into account dietary preferences, and then create random groups for a selection of Leuven's finest restaurants. (Which restaurants exactly will be kept secret until the very last moment.) 

You can book up to a few hours before the dinner moment ‚Äî details to be announced during the conference. 

Image courtesy of Jay Wennington, https://unsplash.com/photos/N_Y88TWmGwA

2019-08-02.name: (def Red  (Wine in Belgium?) )
2019-08-02.description:
Find a good place where drinking good red wine

Not living in Belgium the place could be either the dinner place/restaurant or somewhere else :_)

2019-08-03.name: Creative Coding Jam
2019-08-03.description: Get on stage during the Siesta Break to show off and delight the audience. We simply take turns, demonstrating and live coding our auditory and visual creations.
2019-08-03.requirements:
Bring your laptop and your best creative vibes.

**Only sign up if you want to perform, otherwise just come and check out the stage during the Siesta Break**

2019-08-03.name: Screen printing workshop
2019-08-03.description: Get hands-on with local screen printing crew Scheefdruk. In this 2.5 hour workshop during Saturday's Siesta Break you can learn how screen printing works, and create your own prints.
2019-08-03.requirements: Bring old textile you want to print on

2019-08-04.name: Hapje Tapje
2019-08-04.description: The first Sunday of August the Leuven city centre is the place to be for foodies. Hapje-Tapje is a not-to-be-missed culinary feast in Leuven. In the Muntstraat, Tiensestraat en Hogeschoolplein, Hapje-Tapje allows you to discover some of the many restaurants in Leu-ven while on the Grote Markt, several top restaurants in Leuven serve top-notch dishes un-der one (spectacular) roof. You‚Äôll taste lots of tasty snacks of maximum 5 euro each. The most delicious specialty beers are expertly served at Oude Markt. Borrow a Hapje-Tapje tastng glass at the central stand for 5 euro and enjoy! In the afternoon bartenders male and female are running the traditional bartender race.

2019-08-04.name: Open Source Hackday
2019-08-04.description:
Now that two days of talks have left you feeling inspired, it's time to break out the laptop and do some coding of your own. We provide tables and wifi, the rest is up to you.

If you want to bring people together to work on a specific project, then we recommend making a separate activity for that. There will be time on Saturday to make announcements and rally people to your cause.

2019-08-04.name: Bouldering with Martin
2019-08-04.description:
Hi üëã I'm going bouldering in Berlin a lot and I always enjoy hanging out with people in the gym and trying to climb stuff together. The gym is 13min from Leuven station so it's very easy to get to. 

Let's either meet at [the gym](http://www.boulder.one) or at Leuven station at 11.45. If you have any questions, shoot me a [DM on Twitter](https://twitter.com/martinklepsch)!

**What is bouldering?** Bouldering is a form of climbing, usually on walls not higher than 4-5m. There are foam pads below the walls to protect you in case of a fall. In contrast to sport climbing bouldering does not require a partner for belaying although climbing in a group is always more fun ‚ò∫Ô∏è

**Never done it?** I'll be happy to help you get started, show you how to fall safely etc. Most gyms have intro level climbs that are very approachable.
2019-08-04.requirements: Comfy clothes that can handle a bit of chalk and grainy walls. Shoes can be rented at the gym
